data.title: Memorial Service
data.meta_description: Lord Williams of Mostyn, QCTHE Queen and the Duke of Edinburgh were represented by Baroness Farrington of Ribbleton at a memorial service for Lord Williams of Mostyn, QC, Lord Privy Seal and Leader of
data.text:
Lord Williams of Mostyn, QC

THE Queen and the Duke of Edinburgh were represented by Baroness Farrington of Ribbleton at a memorial service for Lord Williams of Mostyn, QC, Lord Privy Seal and Leader of the House of Lords since 2001, held yesterday in Westminster Abbey.

The Prince of Wales was represented by Lord Morris of Aberavon, QC.

The Dean of Westminster officiated, assisted by the Rev Chris Chivers, Minor Canon. Mr Malcolm Craddock and Miss Victoria Sharp, QC, led prayers in English and Professor Derec Llwyd Morgan, Senior Vice-Chancellor, University of Wales, Aberystwyth, in Welsh.

Earl Ferrers and Lord Dholakia read the lesson and the Hon Imogen Russell Williams, daughter, read her own poem, Sestina.

Mr Jack Straw, Secretary of State for Foreign
